title: Righteousness by Faith
shortSummary: Romans 10 emphasizes the necessity of faith in Christ for salvation, contrasting the righteousness based on the law with the righteousness that comes through faith. Paul expresses his heartfelt desire for Israel's salvation and explains how faith comes through hearing the gospel message preached.
timeline: c. AD 57 - Paul's Epistle to the Romans during his third missionary journey

keyCharacters.name: Paul
keyCharacters.description: The apostle and author of Romans, expressing his deep concern for Israel's salvation and explaining the doctrine of righteousness by faith.

keyCharacters.name: Israel
keyCharacters.description: The nation of Israel, to whom Paul directs his message, highlighting their zeal but lack of submission to God's righteousness through faith.

keyCharacters.name: Moses
keyCharacters.description: The Old Testament lawgiver referenced by Paul to contrast the righteousness of the law with righteousness by faith.

keyCharacters.name: Esaias (Isaiah)
keyCharacters.description: The prophet whose writings Paul quotes to illustrate Israel's unbelief and God's outreach to the Gentiles.

definitions.definition: The state of being morally right or justifiable before God; in this chapter, it contrasts self-established righteousness with that received by faith.
Eager desire or enthusiasm, here referring to Israel's passionate but misdirected efforts to please God without true knowledge.
The verbal acknowledgment of faith in Jesus Christ as Lord, which is linked to salvation.
One who proclaims the gospel message; essential for people to hear and believe in Christ.

outline.heading: Paul’s Desire for Israel’s Salvation
outline.description: Paul expresses his heartfelt prayer for Israel’s salvation, recognizing their zeal but highlighting their failure to submit to God's righteousness through Christ, who fulfills the law.

outline.heading: Righteousness by Faith Explained
outline.description: Paul contrasts the righteousness based on the law with the righteousness that comes by faith, emphasizing confession and belief in the resurrection as the path to salvation.

outline.heading: The Universality of Salvation
outline.description: Paul declares that salvation is available to all—Jew and Gentile alike—through calling on the name of the Lord.

outline.heading: The Necessity of Preaching for Faith
outline.description: Paul explains that faith comes from hearing the gospel, which requires preachers to be sent, underscoring the importance of evangelism.

outline.heading: Israel’s Unbelief and God’s Patience
outline.description: Paul acknowledges that Israel has heard the message but has not believed, quoting Old Testament prophets to show God’s persistent outreach despite their disobedience.

application: Trust fully in Jesus Christ for righteousness rather than relying on personal efforts or religious works.
Confess your faith openly and believe in the resurrection of Christ as the foundation of salvation.
Engage actively in sharing the gospel, recognizing that faith comes through hearing the Word of God.
Pray earnestly for the salvation of those who have not yet believed, especially for the Jewish people as Paul did.

keyVerses.text: That if thou shalt confess with thy mouth the Lord Jesus, and shalt believe in thine heart that God hath raised him from the dead, thou shalt be saved.
keyVerses.significance: This verse clearly states the essential conditions for salvation: confession and belief in the resurrection.

keyVerses.text: So then faith cometh by hearing, and hearing by the word of God.
keyVerses.significance: It emphasizes the vital role of hearing the gospel message in the development of saving faith.

keyVerses.text: For Christ is the end of the law for righteousness to every one that believeth.
keyVerses.significance: This verse highlights Christ as the fulfillment and culmination of the law, bringing righteousness to believers.

keyVerses.text: For whosoever shall call upon the name of the Lord shall be saved.
keyVerses.significance: It affirms the universal offer of salvation to all who call on the Lord.
